name: Lain
content: Qubit! Wake up already. You can’t just sleep all day—we need to get the next batch of seeds into the soil.

name: Qubit
content: Ughhh… just five more minutes. The farm will still be here, you know.

name: Lain
content: Five more minutes won’t grow wheat! Now get moving. Use the arrow keys—up, down, left, right—to walk around the farmland.

name: System
content: Tip: You can also click on yourself to see your current status—like stamina, tools, and what seeds you’re carrying.

name: Qubit
content: Alright, alright… walking, checking status, planting seeds. Got it. Happy now?

name: Lain
content: Not until you’ve planted! Normally, you’d do it by hand—stand on farmland and type: plant("wheat").

name: System
content: Example: If you’re standing on a farmland tile, type plant("wheat") to plant wheat seeds there.

name: Qubit
content: Sounds like tedious work if you ask me. Plant, plant, plant… over and over.

name: Lain
content: That’s why we automate, you lazy lump! You can move with commands like move_left(), move_right(), move_up(), move_down(). Combine them with plant() or harvest() to make scripts that do the work for you.

name: System
content: Automation Example: move_right(); plant("wheat"); move_right(); plant("wheat");

name: Qubit
content: Hmm… so if I get smart about it, I don’t have to break my back farming? Now we’re talking!

name: Lain
content: Exactly. Work smarter, not lazier. Now get to it—we’ve got a whole field waiting for you.

name: System
content: End of Tutorial: You can now experiment with movement, planting, harvesting, and writing simple scripts to automate farming. The rest is up to you.
